description: Redevelopment of existing office/retail building to provide new office/retail building and freestanding residential building adjacent. (amendment to previous approved scheme PSX0104726 relating to total demolition of the original structural frame, relocation of plant to basement and additional 1bed residential unit).
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The whole of the proposed residential development hererby approved shall be completed and available for occupation before any part of the new office floorspace (B1a) is brought into use.

In order to ensure that the development is completed and occupied in accordance with the requirements of polices RE5 (Mixed used developments), HG1 (Loss of residential floorspace) and HG5 (Mixed use development) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000 which seeks to maximise residential floorspace and mixed use development.
Condition : 2 - The residential accommodation hereby approved shall not be used as temporary sleeping accommodation (including holiday lettings) as defined in Section 25 of the GLC (General Powers) Act 1983. 

To ensure the use of the accommodation accords with the Council's housing policies in order to ensure  compliance with the requirements of policy HG23 (Accommodation providing an element of care) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 3 - No development shall commence until details of all materials to be used within all external surfaces of the development have been submitted to and approved by the Council. Full sample panels annotated drawings providing the complete palate of all materials will be required to be submitted. Sample panels will then be retained on site until the work has been completed.

To ensure that the external appearance of the building will be satisfactorily in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 (General environmental protection and improvement) and EN13 (Design of new development) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 4 - Details of the proposed screening to the south elevation of the internal office extension, which forms part of the application herein approved, are to be submitted to and approved by the Council prior to the commencement of works

To ensure that the amenity of adjoining occupiers and future occupiers of the residential component of the application herein approved is maintained, in accordance with policy EN19 (Amenity for occupiers and neighbours) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 5 - The owners or occupiers of the development hereby permitted shall not cause or allow any deliveries to be made to the site other than by using the service area and the service area shall only be used to accommodate vehicles employed in making of deliveries to or from the site.

To prevent inconvenience to other road uses in accordance with policy TR23 (Movement of goods: facilities and amenity) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000. 
Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of development a statement outlining full details of the measures to be employed to ensure the full protection and retention of the trees within the Tottenham Court Road elevation shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council. Such measures shall have full regard to the relevant British Standards, and shall include full details of any trimming or other tree works that may be required. Thereafter the methodology and measures of the approved statement shall be fully implemented during the construction period.

To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the development will not have an adverse effect on existing trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities of the area in accordance with the requirements of policy EN61 (Tree canopy and vegetation) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 7 - No development shall occur until a method statement detailing the construction schedule, method and management of the development hereby granted planning permission has been submitted to and in approved in writing by the Council The statement shall address, inter alia, matters relating to measures to protect residential and highway amenity, delivery times, unloading and storage of materials at the site, construction hours (including outlaying quiet periods of work throughout the day), dust and noise mitigation measures and a schedule outlining the chronological programme  / implementation of works.

To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 (Residential amenity), EN5 (Noise and vibration) and EN7 (Noise and disturbance during construction activity) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.  
Condition : 8 - No process shall be carried on or machinery installed which is not such as could be carried on in any residential area without detriment to the amenity of that area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke, soot, ash, dust or grit. 

To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy RE2 (Residential amenity) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 9 - Before the occupation of the residential units hereby granted permission, a scheme for the sound isolation of the residential units shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council to ensure that the operation of the proposed plant and office uses can occur without detriment to the amenity of adjoining residential preemies by reason of noise. Thereafter all works which form part of the scheme shall be completed before any occupation of the residential units and shall retained thereafter.

To ensure that the use can be accommodated without detriment to the amenity of the surrounding premises by reason of noise in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 (Residential amenity), EN5 (Noise and vibration) and EN6 (Disturbance from plant and machinery) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000. 
Condition : 10 - Before the use commences all plant and machinery shall be sound attenuated and isolated from the structure in accordance with a scheme to be submitted to and approved by the Council such that the use can be carried out without detriment to the amenity of adjoining or surrounding premises.

To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy RE2 (Residential amenity), EN5 (Noise and vibration) and EN6 (Disturbance from plant and machinery) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.  
Condition : 11 - Noise levels at a point 1 metre external to sensitive facades shall be at least 5dB(A) less than the existing background measurement (LA90), expressed in dB(A) when ALL plant/equipment are in operation. Where it is anticipated that any plant/equipment will have a noise that has a distinguishable, discrete continuous note (whine, hiss, screech, hum) and/or if there are distinct impulses (bangs, clicks, clatters, thumps) special attention should be given to reducing the noise levels from that piece of plant/equipment at any sensitive fa�ade to at least 10dB(A) below the LA90, expressed in dB(A). The applicant is therefore required to undertake a full acoustic background noise assessment, the full details of which shall be submitted to the Council, in order that the design criteria for the acoustic enclosure of plant/equipment can be properly assessed.

To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 (Residential amenity), EN5 (Noise and vibration) and EN6 (Disturbance from plant and machinery) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.  
Condition : 12 - For each of the octave band of centre frequencies 63Hz-8KHz inclusive, noise levels from ALL plant/equipment (measured in LAeq) when in operation shall at all times add not more than 1 decibel to the existing background noise level LA90, expressed in dB(A), in the same octave band as measured 1 metre external to sensitive facades.

To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the area generally in accordance with the requirements of policies RE2 (Residential amenity), EN5 (Noise and vibration) and EN6 (Disturbance from plant and machinery) of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.
